topic.title: Enabling Mode for Editing DITA Map Content in One Document

body.p: offers a feature that can be enabled for Git integrations for displaying a DITA map with all of the referenced topic content expanded and editable in one document. This editing mode is supported for all Git repository providers except for Bitbucket Server. It can also be enabled for custom connectors, with the only special consideration is that you need to add a UI to lock/unlock or check-in/check-out each topic reference. To enable this feature, you need to set the editReferencesInPlace parameter to true.
Once enabled, users can trigger this mode by selecting Edit Topic Content from the DITA Map Display Mode drop-down menu.

When editing a DITA map in this mode, the editor provides actions for both editing topic content and editing map content. To implement this behavior, a special framework is used. This framework extends the DITA framework and adds some map-specific actions.
This editing mode may not be available if the file server connector does not support it. For example, with the built-in connectors, this action is available for all types of Git repositories, except for BitBucket Server.
For performance reasons, only modified topics are validated.
Only top-level topics in a DITA file can be edited.
